title: Why Blackout Bands are the latest must-have in-flight accessory
text:
24 shares 1

For anyone who likes to block out all sounds and sights on a plane, the latest travel accessory was made entirely for you.
Introducing: Blackout Bands. These sunglasses are 98 per cent opaque and perfect for concealing your shut-eye from the world. (Or, you know, other plane passengers.)
But it's the mastermind behind these innovative shades that might surprise you most - they were developed by former Twilight star, Kellan Lutz.
Perfect for catching some rays - or discretely stealing a few minutes of shut-eye on a plane - Blackout Bands are sunglasses that are 98 per cent opaque. Pictured: Kellan Lutz wearing the travel accessory
The Hollywood heartthrob first got the idea after an embarrassing in-flight photograph wound up on celebrity blogs and magazines.
While on board a plane a few years ago, he mistakenly opted to don a candy-coloured eye mask to help him catch a few winks.

Hotels in Spanish holiday hotspot of Lloret de Mar given... 24 shares Unfortunately, a paparazzi photographer was also on the flight and snapped a photo of him for all to see.
'It didn't look cool and it didn't fit my tough action-figure persona,' Lutz told Yahoo Travel of the incident.
The sunglasses were developed by Hollywood actor Kellan Lutz after an embarrassing photograph of him wearing a pastel eye mask on a plane wound up on celebrity blogs
From there, Blackout Bands was born.
'I created them not to make money but to solve a problem I had and to help people,' he added.
And they do. Not only are the great for shielding your eyes from the sun - and annoying seatmates during long-haul flights - it turns out that they also help people suffering from migraines and light sensitivities.
If that's not reason enough to convince you to try them out, a portion of BOBs proceeds go to charities that benefit the blind. And they cost from just Â£13.
